title: buri-kun
body: A [[Sanrio]] character, shaped as an anthropomorphic fillet of fish. He looks similar to [[kirimichan.|Kirimichan]], but he can be distinguished by the feminine clothing he wears, such as dresses and bows.

title: half-life:_decay
body:
Expansion pack for the game [[Half-Life 1]], where you play as [[Colette Green]] and [[Gina Cross]] on the day of the resonance cascade. Unique to this expansion pack is co-op play- Requiring either a second player or for one player to use both controllers.

title: beecha_oleg
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] series from 1986.

[b]Beecha Oleg[/b] is a member of [[Judau Ashta]]'s original gang of [[machinery]] scavengers. Beecha has [[freckles]] and orange long hair. He is usually seen by the side of [[Mondo Agake]]. 

Beecha later becomes part of the [[Argama]]'s [i][[Gundam Team]][/i], where he pilots the now repaired [[Hyaku Shiki]].

title: guncannon_detector
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It was first introduced in [[Gundam MSV]] and later appeared in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

[b]MSA-005K Guncannon Detector[/b]

A ground artillery [[mobile suit]] for mid-range support, it was co-manufactured by Karaba, an [[AEUG]] support organization, and [[Anaheim Electronics]] during [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps Conflict]]. It used the movable frame of the AEUG MSA-005 [[Methuss]] as a base, and taking references from the old EFSF RX-77 [[Guncannon]], it has two Vulcan guns and a pair of [[beam cannon]]s. 

Despite this, the suit is not related to the Guncannon, its name was given by one of Karaba's leaders, [[Hayato Kobayashi]], who had piloted a Guncannon during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. Early Karaba/AEUG units were red colored, while later [[char's_counterattack|Londo]] [[gundam_unicorn|Bell]] [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] units were colored blue.
other_names: ガンキャノン・ディテクター

title: mashymre_cello
body:
A fictional antagonist character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]Mashymre Cello[/b] is a high ranking [[military]] officer in [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. His [[mecha]] of choice are the [[Galluss-J]], The [[Hamma Hamma]] and the [[Zaku III Custom]] [[mobile_suit|MS]]. [spoilers]A Haman Karn fanboy. While seeming ridicule at first (due to his many defeats against the [[Argama]]'s [i][[Gundam Team]][/i]), he eventually is turned into a cyber-Newtype and becomes a very dangerous warrior and fearsome MS ace piloting the Zaku III Custom. Dies in combat after decimating several [[Doven Wolf]]s of [[Glemy Toto]]'s renegade faction (commanded by [[Rakan Dahkaran]]) all by himself.[/spoilers]

h4. See also
* [[Illia Pazom]]

title: tachi_(weapon)
body:
A tachi (太刀) was a type of traditionally made Japanese [[sword]] (nihontō) worn by the [[samurai]] class of feudal [[Japan]]. The tachi style of swords preceded the development of the [[katana]] and were primarily used on horseback. 
Tachi and katana generally differ in:
* Curvature: tachi tend to be more curved (both hilt and blade).
* How they are worn: tachi is worn suspended from the belt with its [u]cutting edge downward[/u], while the katana is thrust through the belt with its [u]cutting edge upward[/u] ("see reference":https://www.touken-collection-nagoya.jp/app/uploads/2021/12/55a244760b2a34f0c4e0924f01547517.jpg).
* Length: tachi tend to be longer than the katana.
* Hilt: while katana always have a rayskin-wrapped hilt with silk overwrapping, tachi sometimes only have the rayskin wrapping, though this is far from universal.

h4.See also
* [[Chokutou]], straight swords, were also called tachi, but written as 大刀
* [[Kodachi]]
* [[Ootachi]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links
* "Touken Collection (JP): Difference between Tachi and Katana":https://www.touken-collection-nagoya.jp/touken-introduction/tachi-and-uchigatana/
* "Wikipedia: Tachi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tachi
* "Wikipedia (JP): Tachi":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/太刀

title: nosferatu_eine_symphonie_des_grauens
body: A German silent horror film released in 1922. It was originally going to be an adaptation of Bram Stoker's novel [i]Dracula[/i], but all the characters in the film were renamed to avoid copyright infringement, with Dracula himself known being [[Count Orlok]].
other_names: 吸血鬼ノスフェラトゥ

title: count_orlok
body: A vampire and central antagonist of the 1922 film [i][[nosferatu eine symphonie des grauens|Nosferatu]][/i]. He is technically [[Dracula]], as [i]Nosferatu[/i] was supposed to be an adaptation of Bram Stoker's classic novel at first, but the name was changed in the original film in an attempt to avoid copyright issues (with a later unauthorized edit once more renaming him, this time to Prince Wolkoff).

title: arcade
body:
A place of wonder and merriment, based on various forms of coin-operated mechanical and electronic game machines. Most popular during the 1980's and 1990's as standalone establishments; now largely limited in the West to smaller areas within amusement parks. Still quite popular in Asia.

For the architectural feature by the same name, see [[arcade (architecture)]]. For the large stationary video game machine that is often seen inside an arcade, use [[arcade cabinet]].

title: octoling_girl
body:
The female [[Octoling player character]] from the [[Splatoon_(series)|]] series. Their male counterpart is the [[Octoling Boy]].

In [[Splatoon 3]], with the omission of gender-locked hair, the only canonical difference between male and female octolings is their eyebrows and eye mask markings. With eye masks, Octolings boys do not have an eyelash on the lower outer corners, whereas girls do. For differences in eyebrows between the genders, see below. Please note that these gender differences is subject to artstyle, and not always congruent with canon.

title: galaco
body:
galaco is the image character of "galaxias!", a music unit consisting of Shibasaki Ko (Japanese actor and singer), [[deco27|DECO*27]] and TeddyLoid.

Her [[VOCALOID]] voicebank was developed based on Ko's voice, and released for the VOCALOID3 engine by the YAMAHA Corporation. She was distributed first as an exclusive prize vocal and later commercially for Mac and PC. She also has a speech voicebank that runs on AITalk, the same engine used by [[VOICEROID]].

She has long [[blonde hair]], [[orange eyes]], with [[multicolored hair|multicolored]] bangs. She wears a dress, a [[crown]], and stylized [[belt]].

Her limited accessed [[galaco (prize)|Prize]] voicebank design is by [[kei (keigarou)|KEI]], it’s later replaced by her [[galaco (neo)|NEO]] voicebank with a new design by [[Tomioka Jirou]]. 

h4. Official art

* !post #3754818: [[galaco (prize)|Prize]]
* !post #1788899: [[galaco (neo)|NEO]]
* !post #7826098: [[galaco (white)|WHITE]]
* !post #7826124: [[galaco (black)|BLACK]]

h4. External links

* "Product page":https://www.vocaloid.com/en/products/show/v3l_galaco2_en
* "Yamaha's Vocaloid competition (2011~2012).":http://info.nicovideo.jp/v3contest/

title: hannibal_lecter
body:
The titular character of the Hannibal book series by Thomas Harris and their film and television adaptions. Hannibal is an extremely brilliant but mentally disturbed and cannibalistic serial killer infamous for eating his victims. The books describe him as having [[red eyes]] and "mid ray duplication polydactyly" ([[extra digits|two identical functioning middle fingers]]) on his left hand.

Portrayed by Sir [[Anthony Hopkins]] in most film adapations, such as [[The Silence of the Lambs]]. Portrayed by [[Mads Mikkelsen]] in the [[Hannibal (tv series)|]] NBC television series.
other_names: ハンニバル・レクター

His birthday is May 12th.

title: neet
body:
An acronym for "Not currently engaged in Employment, Education or Training". Originated from the United Kingdom. The demographic prevalence of NEETs is a serious social problem in Japan (among other places), where the term is typically used in a derogatory manner.

The lack of gainful employment can lead a NEET to social withdrawal, thus becoming a [[hikikomori]]. However, it is important when tagging to note that NEET and hikikomori are distinct, if related concepts.

h4. See also

* [[hikikomori]]
* [[home security]]
* [[you work you lose]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: NEET":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NEET]

title: cinnamiku
body: Unofficial name for a design of [[Hatsune Miku]] featured in the limited-time menu and collection of goods at Hatsune Miku x Cinnamoroll Cafe, a collaboration event held from July 15th to August 14th, 2022. In this design, Miku has her twintails [[updo|folded up]] with a [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]]. Depending on the artist, the twintails may be attached as two [[double_bun|hair buns]], two [[hair rings]] or simply just folded in. She often appears together with [[Cinnamoroll]] from [[Sanrio]], who also has [[tied_ears|his ears tied up]] with a [[ear_bow|matching bow]] and occasionally [[hatsune_miku_(cosplay)|wears the same outfit as Miku]]. h4. See also * [[Cinnamiku hairstyle]] * [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]] h4. External links * "Sanrio Event Announcement":https://www.sanrio.co.jp/news/cn-hatsunemiku-cafe-20220711 * "The limited-time menu":https://twitter.com/Cinnamon_cafe_/status/1547741209653039104

title: wedge_heels
body:
[[High heels]] with a thick, raised sole at the back of the shoe, forming a wedge-shaped heel. Also known as [b]espadrilles[/b] or simply as [b]wedges[/b].

Unlike normal heels, the bottom of the shoe is flat, with no gap between the sole and the ground.

If the entire sole is thick, but the heel is thicker than the front, then both [[platform heels]] and [[wedge heels]] may apply.

h4. Examples

* !post #6785068
* !post #6818160

h4. See also

* [[high heels]]
* [[platform heels]]
* [[Tag group:Attire]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Wedge (footwear)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wedge_(footwear)]

title: nicoseiga_sample
body:
An image sourced from nicoseiga that is sampled, and is not the original image.

Nicoseiga post pages have the following characteristics:

URL: http[i]:[/i]//seiga.nicovideo.jp/seiga/im<[b]image ID[/b]>
Preview: http[i]:[/i]//lohas.nicoseiga.jp/thumb/<[b]image ID[/b]>i?
Link: http[i]:[/i]//seiga.nicovideo.jp/image/source/<[b]image ID[/b]>
Fullsize: http[i]:[/i]//lohas.nicoseiga.jp/priv/.../.../<[b]image ID[/b]>

It is Danbooru policy to either replace samples or delete them. See [[image sample]] for more information.

h4. See also

* [[Bad Nicoseiga ID]]: for when any Nicoseiga post or picture are no longer publicly available
* [[MD5 mismatch]]: for when none of the sizes match Danbooru

title: earthen_miraculous_sword
body:
鏈縁无現里 ("Len'en Tasouken") ~ Earthen Miraculous Sword
("Connecting Chain of the Snake Thicket Sword")

Second game of the [[Len'en]] series, released November 18, 2013. The weather in Mugenri became exceptionally cloudy. It's up to [[Houlen Yabusame]], [[Enraku Tsubakura]] or [[Shitodo Kuroji]] to find the perpetrator and solve the incident.

h5. Enemies

* Stage 1 Midboss/Boss: [[Amanomiya Jun]]
* Stage 2 Midboss/Boss: [[Amanomori Shou]]
* Stage 3 Midboss/Boss, Extra Stage Midboss: [[Celeritas Lumen]]
* Stage 4 Midboss/Boss: [[Kokutenshi Hibaru]]

title: brilliant_pagoda_or_haze_castle
body:
連縁天影戦記 ("Len'en Ten'eisenki") ~ Brilliant Pagoda or Haze Castle
("Connecting Link: Heaven & Shadow War Record")

Forth game of the [[Len'en]] series, released June 4, 2015 as a trial. Unlike other shooting games, this one has a cell system, making a "you make your own adventure"-type of game. You go ether left or right to move the bottom bar to your direction. There are three colours in this bar: red (Haze), purple (Neutral) and white (Brilliant). Depending on this, you'll move to different cells, thus at the end you get different bosses on the same stage.

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Houlen Yabusame]]/[[Enraku Tsubakura]]/[[shion_(len'en)|Shion]]
* [[Taira no Fumikado]]/[[Fujiwara no Iyozane]]/[[Umatachi Tsugumi]]
* [[Zuifeng Tenkai]]/[[Katano Sukune]]/[[Kitsugai Sese]]
* [[Shitodo Kuroji]]/[[Shitodo Hooaka]]/[[Shitodo Aoji]]

h5. Enemies

* Stage 1 Boss Haze route: [[Mitsumo]]
* Stage 1 Boss Neutral route: [[Kurohebi]] or [[Amanomiya Jun]]
* Stage 1 Boss Brilliant route: [[Shirami Souko]]
* Stage 2 Boss Haze route: [[Kesa Kujiru]]
* Stage 2 Boss Neutral route: [[Shitodo Aoji]], [[Amanomori Shou]], or [[Umatachi Tsugumi]]
* Stage 2 Boss Brilliant route: [[Moritake Medias]]
* Stage 3 Boss Haze route: [[Azuma Kaisen]]
* Stage 3 Boss Neutral route: [[Fujiwara no Iyozane]], [[Kitsugai Sese]], or [[Celeritas Lumen]]
* Stage 3 Boss Brilliant route: [[Ooya Kunimitsu]]
* Stage 4 Boss Haze route: [[Ogata Garaiya]]
* Stage 4 Boss Neutral route: [[Shitodo Hooaka]], [[Kokutenshi Hibaru]], or [[Adagumo no Saragimaru]]
* Stage 4 Boss Brilliant route: [[Kashiwagi Kaoru]]
* Stage 5 Boss Haze route: [[para_(len'en)|Para]]
* Stage 5 Boss Neutral route: [[Shitodo Kuroji]], [[Katano Sukune]], or [[Taira no Fumikado]]
* Stage 5 Boss Brilliant route: [[Fujiwara no Shirogane no Sanra]]
* Stage 6 Boss Haze route: [[Taira no Chouki]]
* Stage 6 Boss Neutral: [[Houlen Yabusame]], [[Enraku Tsubakura]], [[Clause (len'en)|]], [[Adagumo no Yaorochi]], [[shion_(len'en)|Shion]], or [[Zuifeng Tenkai]]
* Stage 6 Boss Brilliant route: [[Ooama no Ake no Mitori]]
* Stage 6 Boss Hidden route: [[Kuzu Suzumi]]
* Extra Stage Boss Haze route: [[Ametsukana Yago]]
* Extra Stage Boss Neutral route: [[Xeno a]]
* Extra Stage Boss Brilliant route: [[Senri Haiji]]
* Extra+α Boss: [[Kuzu Suzumi]] (first disguised as [[Senri Tsurubami]], then as themself)

* "Len'en Wiki: Brilliant Pagoda or Haze Castle":http://lenen.shoutwiki.com/wiki/Brilliant_pagoda_or_haze_castle

title: ore_to_kanojo_ga_maou_to_yuusha_de_seitokaichou
body:
A light novel by Aikawa Jou and illustrated by [[H2SO4]].  It was published by ASCII Media Works in May 2010 with strong initial sales.  It was recalled in June 2010 due to major plagiarism issues with portions of dialog taken from other works, such as [[Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu]].

The series takes place at a school for humans and non-humans with two opposing student councils, the Hero's student council and the Maou's student council.  The main character's childhood friend becomes the Hero, but somehow he ends up with the position of Maou.  He is now forced to conceal his identity as the Maou from his childhood friend.

h4. Characters

h6. Main

* [[Tozawa Koutarou]]
* [[Fushigino Alice]]

h6. Maou's Student Council (Demon King's)

* [[Kujouin Kagami]]
* [[Yukino (Ore to Kanojo ga Maou to Yuusha de Seitokaichou)|Yukino]]
* [[Boushi Yae]]
* [[Lily Lendbrum]]

h6. Yuusha's Student Council (Brave Warrior's)

* [[Moto Yuusha]]
* [[Kongou Musashi]]
* [[Mitsuba Kaede]]
* [[Kurono Magokoro]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia (JP): 俺と彼女が魔王と勇者で生徒会長":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/俺と彼女が魔王と勇者で生徒会長
other_names: 俺と彼女が魔王と勇者で生徒会長

title: double_spoiler
body:
ダブルスポイラー ～ 東方文花帖 "Double Spoiler ~ Touhou Bunkachou"

Seventeenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, twelfth in the Windows generation, and fifth spinoff, as well as the second spinoff based on the mainstream danmaku format. Also known as "Touhou 12.5", released 14 March 2010 at Reitaisai 7.

The game marks the return of [[Shameimaru Aya]] on another round of picture-taking escapades, this time covering various characters from [[Mountain of Faith]] to [[Undefined Fantastic Object]], including recurring protagonists [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]], as well as characters introduced in the fighting spinoffs: [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Nagae Iku]] and [[Hinanawi Tenshi]] - but now with competition in the form of [[himekaidou_hatate|a rival journalist]].

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Shameimaru Aya]]
* [[Himekaidou Hatate]]

h5. Enemies

* Level 1: [[Aki Shizuha]] and [[Aki Minoriko]]
* Level 2: [[Mizuhashi Parsee]] and [[Kagiyama Hina]]
* Level 3: [[Kurodani Yamame]], [[Kisume]] and [[Tatara Kogasa]]
* Level 4: [[Kawashiro Nitori]] and [[Inubashiri Momiji]]
* Level 5: [[Kumoi Ichirin]] and [[Murasa Minamitsu]]
* Level 6: [[Ibuki Suika]] and [[Hoshiguma Yuugi]]
* Level 7: [[Toramaru Shou]] and [[Nazrin]]
* Level 8: [[Kaenbyou Rin]] and [[Reiuji Utsuho]]
* Level 9: [[Komeiji Satori]] and [[Komeiji Koishi]]
* Level 10: [[Hinanawi Tenshi]] and [[Nagae Iku]]
* Level 11: [[Yasaka Kanako]] and [[Moriya Suwako]]
* Level 12: [[Hijiri Byakuren]] and [[Houjuu Nue]]
* Level EX: [[Hakurei Reimu]], [[Kirisame Marisa]] and [[Kochiya Sanae]]
* Level Spoiler (if playing as Aya): Himekaidou Hatate
* Level Spoiler (if playing as Hatate): Shameimaru Aya

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Double Spoiler":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Double_Spoiler

title: ten_desires
body:
東方神霊廟 ("Touhou Shinreibyou") ~ Ten Desires
("Divine Spirit Mausoleum")

Nineteenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, thirteenth of the mainstream lineup, and fourteenth overall game of the Windows generation, as well as the eighth mainstream game of the same generation.

A large number of divine spirits are running free. Knowing this can't be left unchecked, [[Hakurei Reimu|Reimu]] decides to investigate. Joining as usual is [[Kirisame Marisa|Marisa]]. Intent on furthering her training, [[Kochiya Sanae]] joins once again, this time to achieve that goal by learning how to use these spirits more effectively. [[Konpaku Youmu]] also joins for the first time since [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]], so that she may deal with the spirits not under her control.

h4. Characters

h5. Heroines

* [[Hakurei Reimu]] 
* [[Kirisame Marisa]]
* [[Kochiya Sanae]]
* [[Konpaku Youmu]]

h5. Enemies

* Stage 1 Boss: [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] (reappearance)
* Stage 2 Midboss/Boss: [[Kasodani Kyouko]]
* Stage 3 Midboss: [[Tatara Kogasa]] (reappearance)
* Stage 3 Boss/Stage 4 Supporting Boss: [[Miyako Yoshika]]
* Stage 4 Midboss/Boss: [[Kaku Seiga]]
* Stage 5 Midboss/Final Stage Supporting Boss: [[Soga no Tojiko]]
* Stage 5 Boss/Final Stage Supporting Boss: [[Mononobe no Futo]]
* Final Stage Boss: [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]]
* Extra Stage Midboss: [[Houjuu Nue]] (reappearance)
* Extra Stage Boss: [[Futatsuiwa Mamizou]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Ten Desires":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Ten_Desires

title: yousei_daisensou
body:
妖精大戦争 ～ 東方三月精 ("Yousei Daisensou ~ Touhou Sangetsusei")
("Great Fairy Wars ~ Touhou Sangetsusei")

Eighteenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, thirteenth in the Windows generation, sixth spinoff overall, and third spinoff based on the mainstream danmaku format. Numbered "Touhou 12.8" and released 14 August 2010 at Comiket 78.

The game is based on the [i]Sangetsusei[/i] manga series ([i]Eastern and Little Nature Deity[/i], [i]Strange and Bright Nature Deity[/i] and [i]Oriental Sacred Place[/i]), with artwork by [i]Sangetsusei[/i] artist [[Hirasaka Makoto]], making the game the first collaborative spinoff not involving Tasogare Frontier.

In her first-ever protagonist role, [[Cirno]] declares war on the Three Mischievous Fairies - [[Luna Child]], [[Sunny Milk]] and [[Star Sapphire]] - in their first in-game appearance.

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Cirno]]

h5. Enemies

h6. Mid-boss

* [[Lily White]]
* [[Lily Black]]
* [[Daiyousei]]

h6. Boss

* [[Sunny Milk]]
* [[Luna Child]]
* [[Star Sapphire]]

h6. Extra Boss

* [[Kirisame Marisa]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Fairy Wars":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Fairy_Wars

title: nimble_fabric
body:
The [[purple]] [[checkered]] [[fabric]] that [[Kijin Seija]] uses as a tool in [[Impossible Spell Card]]. It allows Seija to briefly hide in the nimble, becoming invincible but immobile and harmless.

It is a parody of [[Doraemon]]'s "Hirari Mantle":[https://strategywiki.org/wiki/Doraemon/Items#Shooter_items].

title: impossible_spell_card
body:
弾幕アマノジャク ("Danmaku Amanojaku") ～ Impossible Spell Card

The 14.3rd official installment of the [[Touhou]] games, featuring [[Kijin Seija]] as the protagonist. The game was released 11 May 2014, at Reitaisai 11. As the title implies, it is a spinoff game consisting mostly of spell cards that would be impossible (or nearly impossible) to beat in regular [i]Touhou[/i] games, but the player disposes of various "cheat items", each with its particular ability, as a help to defeat the enemies.

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Kijin Seija]]

h5. Enemies
* Day 1: [[Tsukumo Yatsuhashi]], [[Wakasagihime]] and [[Cirno]]
* Day 2: [[Kasodani Kyouko]] and [[Sekibanki]]
* Day 3: [[Imaizumi Kagerou]], [[Kamishirasawa Keine]] and [[Fujiwara no Mokou]]
* Day 4: [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]], [[Kaku Seiga]] and [[Miyako Yoshika]]
* Day 5: [[Horikawa Raiko]], [[Tsukumo Benben]] and [[Tsukumo Yatsuhashi]]
* Day 6: [[Futatsuiwa Mamizou]], [[Shameimaru Aya]], [[Himekaidou Hatate]], [[Kawashiro Nitori]] and [[Inubashiri Momiji]]
* Day 7: [[Kirisame Marisa]], [[Izayoi Sakuya]], [[Konpaku Youmu]] and [[Kochiya Sanae]]
* Day 8: [[Sukuna Shinmyoumaru]], [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Futatsuiwa Mamizou]]
* Day 9: [[Yasaka Kanako]], [[Moriya Suwako]], [[Mononobe no Futo]] and [[Ibuki Suika]]
* Day 10: [[Hijiri Byakuren]], [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]], [[Hinanawi Tenshi]], [[Remilia Scarlet]] and [[Yakumo Yukari]]

h4. See also

* [[Nimble Fabric]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Impossible Spell Card":http://en.touhouwiki.net/Impossible_Spell_Card

title: strange_creators_of_outer_world
body:
An official [[Touhou]] magazine which began on 30 September 2015 and is published every three months by Kadokawa under the Dengeki Moeoh imprint. [i]Touhou[/i] creator [[ZUN]] has full supervision of the project. The magazine provides information to new fans of the series, introductions and interviews with creators of [i]Touhou[/i] doujin works and continues the print series [[Curiosities of Lotus Asia]].

h4. External links

* "Official Website (Japanese)":http://tohogairai.dengeki.com/

title: immaterial_and_missing_power
body:
東方萃夢想 ("Touhou Suimusou") ~ Immaterial and Missing Power
("Gathering Dreams in the East")

Eighth game in the [[Touhou]] series, third in the Windows generation, and first spinoff, as well as the first fighting spinoff made in collaboration with Tasogare Frontier. Labeled as "Touhou 7.5".

An incessant occurrence of feasts began troubling residents of [[Gensokyo]], thus only 3 days before another such feast occurs, 6 girls decide to investigate and filter out the source - a [[ibuki_suika|party-loving oni]] who hopes that the feasts finally lure her fellow oni out of centuries of hiding underground.

h4. Characters

* [[Hakurei Reimu]]

* [[Alice Margatroid]]

title: imperishable_night
body:
東方永夜抄 ("Touhou Eiyashou") ~ Imperishable Night
("Eternal Night Vignette from the East")

Ninth game of the [[Touhou]] series, eighth of the mainstream lineup, and fourth of the Windows generation, as well as the third mainstream game in the same generation.

On the eve of the Harvest Moon Festival in [[Gensokyo]], youkai sense that the moon has been stolen and replaced with a false one. Someone must freeze time and find the real moon to ensure a full moon on the night of the festival. To this end, a pair of a human and a youkai (4 pairs in total) go in search of the real moon, leading them to a [[yagokoro_eirin|genius pharmacist]] and her charge, the [[houraisan_kaguya|exiled princess of the Moon]].

title: phantasmagoria_of_flower_view
body:

("Oriental Flower Viewing Mound")

Tenth game in the [[Touhou]] series, ninth in the mainstream lineup, fifth in the Windows generation, and fourth mainstream game in the same generation.

An unusual spring has befallen in [[Gensokyo]] - flowers from all seasons start blooming at the same time. Various girls, with various reasons, wander around gathering clues in search of a solution, one which will lead them to a [[onozuka_komachi|lackadaisical shinigami]] and her [[Shiki Eiki|busybody employer]].

The game features the "versus system" introduced in the PC-98 generation's [[Phantasmagoria of Dim.Dream]].

Notorious for its manual, which gave Cirno her nickname "[[circled 9|⑨]]".

body:

("Chronicles of the Wind God of the East")

Twelfth game in the [[Touhou]] series, tenth in the mainstream lineup, and seventh in the Windows generation, as well as the fifth mainstream game in the same generation.

One autumn, a [[kochiya_sanae|mysterious stranger]] approaches the Hakurei Shrine and orders it closed to make way for the Moriya Shrine atop Youkai Mountain. A displeased [[Hakurei Reimu]] and a bored [[Kirisame Marisa]] decide to enter Youkai Mountain - a place forbidden to humans - to confront the [[yasaka_kanako|new goddess]] atop the mountain.

title: hidan_no_aria
body:
An ongoing 2008 light novel series by Akamatsu Chuugaku and illustrated by [[Kobuichi]], with an ongoing 2009 manga adaptation illustrated by [[Koyoka Yoshino]], a spring 2011 anime adaptation by [[J.C. Staff]], and an ongoing 2010 spinoff manga [[Hidan no Aria AA]] illustrated by Tachibana Shogako, with its own anime adaptation by J.C. Staff. 

On the way to school, [[Tooyama Kinji]], a student of Tokyo Butei High, a prestigious school which trains youths to become "Butei" - armed civilian law enforcers - nearly fell victim to a serial bomber known as the "Butei Killer", were he not saved by [[kanzaki h. aria|Kanzaki H. Aria]], his diminutive schoolmate and an elite gunner/swordsman. Despite his misgivings about his life as a Butei, Kinji nevertheless joins her in hunting down the "Butei Killer" before more of their schoolmates are endangered.

title: a_song_of_ice_and_fire
body:
A high fantasy novel series by American author [[George R.R. Martin]], running since 1996 with five novels (out of a projected seven) as of 2012.

The saga revolves around three interconnected stories, set in a world where summer and winter can last decades: a seven-way war for the throne of Westeros, a looming threat of supernatural beings from beyond a massive wall of ice as a long winter approaches, and an exiled princess' quest to retake Westeros from the usurpers who killed her father.

The saga is unique among its genre for its impartial third-person point-of-view provided by dozens of characters of differing allegiances and personalities, as well as toning down the genre's more fantastic elements in favor of battles, political intrigue and moral ambiguity.


h4. Books 

* 1: "A Game of Thrones":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Game_of_Thrones (August 1996) 
* 2: "A Clash of Kings":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Clash_of_Kings (February 1999) 
* 3: "A Storm of Swords":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Storm_of_Swords (November 2000) 
* 4: "A Feast for Crows":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Feast_for_Crows (November 2005) 
* 5: "A Dance with Dragons":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Dance_with_Dragons (July 2011) 
* 6: The Winds of Winter (TBA) 
* 7: A Dream of Spring (TBA) 

h4. See also 

* [[Game of Thrones]] - The television adaptation of the novel
* [[House of the Dragon]] - The television adaptation of the Targaryen civil war Dance of the Dragons

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: A Song of Ice and Fire":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Song_of_Ice_and_Fire 
* "A Wiki of Fire and Ice":http://awoiaf.westeros.org/

title: john_glenn
body:
[b]John Herschel Glenn Jr.[/b] (July 18, 1921 – December 8, 2016)

American military officer, [[astronaut]] and politician. A United States [[Marine Corps]] fighter pilot in [[World War II]] and the Korean War. Chosen as one of the Mercury Seven, the first American astronauts. Became the first American to orbit the Earth on 20 February 1962 aboard the spacecraft [i]Friendship 7[/i]. Was elected to the US Senate representing the state of Ohio from 1974 through 1999. On 29 October 1998, he returned to space aboard the [[Space Shuttle]], becoming the oldest man to orbit the Earth.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: John Glenn":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Glenn

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair|black]] or [[brown hair]], [[black eyes|black]] or [[brown eyes]], and wears a long [[white dress]] with matching long [[white gloves]] and white [[hair ribbon]].

Yamato is the mental model, a [[personification]], of the Fleet of Fog battleship Yamato.  The battleship is either modeled after or is a resurrection of the World War 2 Japanese battleship Yamato.

h4. External links

title: barioth
body:
A flying [[wyvern]] from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series.

The Ice Fanged Wyvern, Barioth, is a large white quadrupedal dragon that exhibits cat-like characteristics. It's very well adapted to the freezing environment of the tundra, where it preys on the [[Popo]] that live there. Featured prominently are Barioth's two large amber tusks, and its well developed forearms, adorned with large claws that help it move quickly across the ice. It is also capable of firing ice chunks at its foes that can cause severe cold.  

First introduced in [[Monster Hunter 3]], a brown subspecies better adapted to life in the desert was introduced in [[Monster Hunter Portable 3rd]].

It's [[Barioth (Armor)|armor set]] is very popular amongst fans, being one of the most prominent after the [[Kirin (Armor)|Kirin]] set.

h4. See also

* [[Barioth (Armor)]]

h4. External links

* "Monster Hunter Wiki: Barioth":http://monsterhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Barioth

title: tigrex
body:
A pseudowyvern from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series and flagship monster of [[Monster Hunter Portable 2nd]].

The Tigrex, also known as the "Roaring Wyvern", resembles a quadripedal [[tyrannosaurus rex]] with wings protruding from its forelegs and yellow-and-blue striped scales. It primarily lives on the desert, though also known to migrate to mountains to feast on [[popo|Popos]].

The Tigrex are notorious for their sheer ferocity and agility, using their jaws, claws and tail to destroy their enemies, as well as a roar that can damage and blow away any enemy who comes too close.

[[Monster Hunter Portable 3rd]] introduces a black subspecies suited for life on volcanoes and with an even greater ferocity.

h4. See also

* [[Tigrex (armor)]]

h4. External links

* "Monster Hunter Wiki: Tigrex":http://monsterhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Tigrex

title: rathian
body:
A flying [[wyvern]] from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series.

Rathian are large, green, fire-breathing dragons known as the Queen of the [[Wyvern|Wyverns]]. All are female, the males are called [[Rathalos]]. Unlike Rathalos, Rathian fight primarily on the land, using fireballs and venomous spines that cover their backs and the end of their tails. They're often inhabit forests, swamps, and deserts environments.

There are two subspecies; the Pink Rathian, a pink variant, and the Gold Rathian, a rare variant with a golden sheen. Originally appearing in [[Monster Hunter G]], they have both reappeared in [[Monster Hunter Portable 3rd]] and in [[Monster Hunter 3 G]]. A third, black subspecies has been introduced for [[Monster Hunter Frontier]], as well.

h4. See also

* [[Rathian (Armor)]]
* [[Rathalos]]

h4. External links

* "Monster Hunter Wiki: Rathian":http://monsterhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Rathian

title: rathalos
body:
A flying [[wyvern]] from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series.

Rathalos are large, red, fire-breathing dragons known as the King of the [[Wyvern|Wyverns]]. All are male, the females are called [[Rathian]]. Unlike Rathian, Rathalos fights mostly from the air, has poisonous talons, and is able to shoot fireballs while in flight. They're often found in wooded and volcanic regions.

The flagship monster for the first game in the series, it has appeared in every game since, and often represents the series in crossovers such as those in [[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]] and [[Dragalia Lost]].

There are two known subspecies; the Azure Rathalos, a blue variant, and the Silver Rathalos, a rare variant with a metallic silver sheen. Originally appearing in [[Monster Hunter G]], they have both made a reappearance in [[Monster Hunter Portable 3rd]] and in [[Monster Hunter 3 G]].

h4. See also

* [[Rathalos (Armor)]]
* [[Rathian]]

h4. External links

* "Monster Hunter Wiki: Rathalos":http://monsterhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Rathalos

In 2034, the idol industry is in a slump after the disappearance of the legendary unit "7th Sisters." As the new leader of the idol studio "777," aka Nanastar, you seek to bring new idols to fame.

A 70-minute anime movie adaptation was announced for summer 2020.

title: aoki_hagane_no_arpeggio
body:
A sci-fi seinen manga series by [[Ark Performance]] and published in Young King Ours.

The series revolves around the crew of the submarine [[I-401 (aoki hagane no arpeggio)|]], a sentient ship that has rebelled against the mysterious navy, known as the Fleet of Fog that is composed of naval vessels that possess weapons and armor that completely outmatches those possessed by humans. The Fleet of Fog in 2039 took control of the seas around the world and cut off transport between continents and islands by all means except expensive SSTO (single-stage-to-orbit) space vehicle launches. The series begins in 2056 with the I-401 and its crew requested to protect a Japanese SSTO launch from the Fleet of Fog.

A 12-episode CG anime adaptation of the series titled Arpeggio of Blue Steel -Ars Nova- aired Fall 2013. A spin-off manga titled ソルティ・ロード (Salty Road) by TALI, author of 6 no Trigger, began publication October 2014

title: takao_(aoki_hagane_no_arpeggio)
body:
A character from [[Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] blue to light [[blue hair]], normally in a [[ponytail]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her standard outfit is a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress]] with [[black pantyhose]] and a [[black choker]].

Takao is the mental model, a [[personification]], of the Fleet of Fog heavy cruiser Takao.  The heavy cruiser is either modeled after or is a resurrection of the World War 2 Japanese Takao-class heavy cruiser Takao. She is also famously [[tsundere]], having gained the in-series nickname "Tsundere Heavy Cruiser".

title: lagiacrus
body:
A leviathan [[monster]] from the [[Monster Hunter (series)|]] series.

Known as the Lord of the Seas, the Lagiacrus is a species of large, blue, aquatic [[monster]] that dwell in the sea and large bodies of fresh water. It's capable of generating electricity through the dermal spikes on it's back and unleashing it in the form of devastating Thunder attacks. It's also known to come onto dry land to sunbathe and rest. While most at home in the sea, it's more than capable of defending itself on land.

Lagiacrus is the flagship monster of [[Monster Hunter 3]], where it was first introduced. Despite this, it did not appear in [[Monster Hunter Portable 3rd]]. It is, however, set to reappear in [[Monster Hunter 3 G]], in addition to a white subspecies.

h4. See also

* [[Lagiacrus (Armor)]]

h4. External links

* "Monster Hunter Wiki: Lagiacrus":http://monsterhunter.wikia.com/wiki/Lagiacrus

title: andrew_cunningham
body:
A senior [[Royal Navy]] officer who served with distinction through two World Wars, primarily in [[World War II]].

In 1936, he was promoted to vice-admiral, and in 1937 was made second-in-command of the Mediterranean Fleet aboard HMS [i]Hood[/i]. Three years later, he was made full commander in chief of the same Mediterranean Fleet aboard HMS [i]Warspite[/i] and led it through the naval battles of Calabria (July 1940) and Cape Matapan (March 1941). He was also responsible for the night air raid on Taranto (November 1940) that heavily damaged three Italian battleships (and may have even influenced Japanese plans for Pearl Harbor).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Andrew Cunningham, 1st Viscount Cunningham of Hyndhope":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andrew_Cunningham,_1st_Viscount_Cunningham_of_Hyndhope]
other_names: アンドリュー・ブラウン・カニンガム

title: himemushi_momoyo
body: Onyx Dragon-Eater Extra boss of [[Unconnected Marketeers]]. An oomukade (“giant centipede”) capable of eating dragons. Momoyo has [[long_hair|long]], [[messy_hair|messy]] [[grey hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. She carries a [[gold]] [[holding_pickaxe|pickaxe]] on her left and a [[gold]] [[holding_shovel|shovel]] on her right. She wears a [[skirt_set|matching]] [[shirt]] and [[skirt]] combo, and goes [[barefoot]]. Her limbs are adorned with many [[orange_bow|orange bows]], while her clothes have many [[ring|rings]] attached to them. A dragon-slaying centipede princess, she was approached by Megumu for a job mining the dragon gems. Unusually among Touhou characters, she refers to herself with the masculine personal pronoun "ore". Also notable is how she is one of the few characters in the series without a hat or head accessory. h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Momoyo Himemushi":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Momoyo_Himemushi

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[two-tone hair]], [[blonde_hair|blonde]] and [[brown hair|brown]]. She wears [[patterned clothing|patterned]] and [[multicolored clothes]], divided in a [[yellow_skirt|yellow]] [[medium_skirt|medium-length]] [[skirt]] and a [[red shirt]] with [[short puffy sleeves]], tied with a [[sash]]. She also wears whiteish-purple [[earrings]] identical to her [[headpiece]], going around [[barefoot]]. h4. title: mardock_scramble
body:
A 2003, three volume cyperpunk scifi novel series by "Ubukata Tow":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tow_Ubukata.

In 2010, it was adapted into an manga series and an anime movie series, that as of 2011 has 2 films out (Mardock Scramble: The First Compression and Mardock Scramble: The Second Combustion).

The series is about a 15-year-old girl named [[Rune Balot]], who had been taken in by a man named Shell Septinos. At the start of the series Shell attempts to kill Rune Balot, slitting her throat and leaving her for dead in a burning car. She is rescued by the private investigator Dr. Easter and his partner, an intelligent synthetic mouse, named [[OEufcoque|Œufcoque]]. To save her life, they performed a normally illegal procedure that replaced the entire skin of her body with a synthetic skin. This skin ends up granting her super human abilities, being able to completely sense her surroundings without sight and granting her the ability to manipulate electronics around her.

h4. Characters

* [[Rune Balot]]
* [[OEufcoque]]

* [[Tweedledum_(mardock_scramble)|]]

h4. External links

title: mackintosh_rose
body:
A [[rose]] that is drawn as if looking at it [[from above]], with all its petals closely bound to one another, their edges overlapping.

The design was created by Scottish architect and artist Charles Rennie Mackintosh.

Because it closely follows [[art nouveau]] themes, the Mackintosh Rose differs from the [[stenciled rose]] in many ways. The flower is often closer to budding than being in full bloom, which causes the overall shape of the flower to be more circular. Additionally, the wedges representing the petals are more tightly wrapped and have a more similar crescent-like shape.

[[Ginrei (giant robo)|]] from [[Giant Robo]] has this design on the breast of her [[China dress]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #22620078

h4. See also

* [[art nouveau]]
* [[stenciled rose]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Charles Rennie Mackintosh":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Rennie_Mackintosh

body:
An inedible garnish for [[cocktail|cocktails]], usually made of metal or plastic, intended to be speared through small foods such as cherries or olives. They may also be used in lieu of [[toothpick|toothpicks]] for serving hors d'oeuvres and finger foods. They come in a variety of shapes; some resemble tiny [[sword|swords]] while others may be tipped with beads or geometric shapes.

title: pulque
body:
A viscous, milk-colored, alcoholic beverage made from the [i][[agave]] americana[/i] plant.

It became a [[meme]] based on a commercial aired during the broadcast of the final episodes of [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] on April 22, 2011.  The commercial can be seen "here":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QNSesAZuXPE.  The narrator asks "謎の白い液体の正体とは？" (What is the identity of this [[suggestive fluid|mysterious white liquid]]?).  And, of course, only fanartists dare to show us the answer.

h4. See also

title: octoling_player_character
body:
A customizable player character from the [[Splatoon_(series)|]] series starting from [[Splatoon 2]]. The player can choose an [[Octoling Boy]] or [[Octoling Girl]].

This tag is for the Octoling that serve as the player's character, and for octopus form Octolings. Do not use it for named characters such as [[Marina (splatoon)|]] or [[Shiver_(splatoon)|]].

In [[Splatoon 3]], with the omission of gender-locked hair, the only canonical difference between male and female octolings is their eye masks. Octolings boys do not have an eyelash in the lower outer corners of their eye masks. Please note, however, that this is also subject to artstyle.

See [[Octoling]] (species) Wiki for a list of named Octolings (e.g. the Idols) and a section on how to differentiate between Octoling and [[Inkling]]s.

title: the_night_guest
body:
Ever since the death of her husband, Mrs. Arakawa has run her inn alone. There's never been a guest the seasoned innkeeper couldn't handle... but she's never had to host a hungry oni. It'll take all her wits and wiles to survive the night in his service--or else she may find herself in his mouth.

[i]The Night Guest[/i] is a spin-off from [The Dragon Double Feature 2](https://taylor-titmouse.itch.io/dragondoubled), but takes place before it and can be read as a stand-alone story. This book features an older woman seducing a younger man, size difference, mommy dom, cunnilingus, praise, teaching, cowgirl position, and mating press.

https://taylor-titmouse.itch.io/the-night-guest

title: fairy_miku_(project_voltage)
body:
A character design by [[Mizutani Megumi]] for the [[Pokemon]] and [[Vocaloid]] collaboration [[Project Voltage]] that imagines [[Hatsune Miku]] as a Fairy-type Pokemon trainer.

Fairy Miku has [[colored eyelashes|pink eyelashes]], [[blue eyes|blue]]-[[pink eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[curly hair|curly]] hair with [[sidelocks]] that is a [[two-tone hair|mix]] of [[blue hair|blue]] and [[pink hair|pink]] that she styles in [[twintails]]. Her hair is decorated with [[red flower|red]], [[white flower|white]] and [[yellow flower|yellow]] [[hair flower|flowers]] as well as [[hair ornament|beads]] scattered throughout. She [[nail polish|paints]] her fingernails [[pink nails|pink]] and wears bead [[earrings]], a [[pink choker]] with a [[heart choker|heart in the middle]], a [[pink sweater]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[white collar]] and a [[white neckerchief]], a [[yellow scrunchie]] on her left [[wrist scrunchie|wrist]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], [[loose socks|loose]] [[white socks]] and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[loafers]]. She carries a white [[pillow]] with [[bag charm|charms]] attached to the strap that also appears to function as a [[white bag|bag]].

h4. Official art

* !post #6697959
* !post #6697993

h4. List of Miku trainer types

body:
[[yuzuki_yukari_(vocaloid4)|Vocaloid4]] variation of [[Yuzuki Yukari]] representing a whisper voice.

Wears a light pink [[hoodie]] with [[rabbit hood]], [[white dress]] and [[pantyhose]] (right with [[rabbit print]] and left with [[floral print]]). Has [[purple hair]] (a bit lighter colour then original) with [[hair flower]] as [[hair ornament|ornament]].

title: yuzuki_yukari_(a.i._voice_2)
body:
A design for [[Yuzuki Yukari]]'s voicebank on the updated [[A.I. VOICE|A.I.VOICE®2]] engine, illustrated by [[Ayakura Juu]].

She has a more casual outfit featuring a white and black theme with green highlights:
* [[short sleeves|Short sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with [[rabbit print]]
* [[black dress|Black]] [[pinafore dress]] with a [[see-through skirt layer]] printed with [[moon phases]]
* White [[asymmetrical legwear]]
* [[Black gloves]] with her signature [[bangle]]
* Purple [[shoulder sash]] and [[belt]]

Kizuna Akari's matching voicebank, [[Kizuna Akari (A.I. Voice 2)]], also has a matching outfit.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6869214

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: yuzuki_yukari_(a.i._voice)
body:
A design for [[Yuzuki Yukari]]'s [[A.I. VOICE]] voicebank, illustrated by [[Ayakura Juu]].

She wears a white sleeveless shirt with [[rabbit print]], a [[black jacket]] [[jacket_on_shoulder|over her shoulders]], black [[bike shorts]], [[black thighighs]], and boots. She wears her usual [[bangle]] but has an abbreviated version of her usual [[hair ornament]] that now consists of one circle instead of  two.

Not to be confused with her other A.I. VOICE design, [[Yuzuki Yukari (Shizuku)]], which is a younger version of herself.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4682274
* !post #6742965

h4. See also

* [[Yuzuki Yukari (A.I. VOICE 2)]]
* [[Yuzuki Yukari (Shizuku)]]
* [[Yuzuki Yukari (Nagi)]]
* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: tsunose_kotone_(tsubomi)
body:
[[Tsunose Kotone]]'s Tsubomi design, released alongside her main [[A.I. Voice]] voicebank. 

Like other Tsubomi, Kotone's Tsubomi design is noticeably younger. In contrast to her main design, she has [[short hair|shorter hair]] and wears a white [[sailor hat]], [[sailor collar]], and [[shorts]] along with a black [[undershirt]] and a [[shoulder bag]].

h4. Official art

* !post #6303046
* !post #6314162

title: dan'in-san_(shirogane_noel)
body:
Representation of [[Shirogane Noel]] fanbase, known as Shirogane Kishidan (Shirogane Order) They are depicted as [[hamster]]s wearing [[rice bowl]]s [[bowl hat|on their heads]] as helmets and Noel's crest on their back. They are based on Noel's real-life pet hamster [[pop (shirogane noel)|Pop-chan]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #22618374

h4. See also

* [[Pop (Shirogane Noel)]]
* [[List of Hololive Mascots]]

title: haruka_(haruko_minami)
body:
An [[original]] character designed by [[zap-nik]], requested by Haruko Minami.

A test subject of government experiment on creating the immortal soldier under the codename [b]PG-9 (ПГ-9)[/b].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[red eyes]] post-incident and with [[brown hair]], [[blue eyes]] pre-incident.

Her default outfit is: [[white shirt]] with [[red necktie]], [[grey pants]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]] for hiking. She also uses [[shoulder holster]] for her pistol, [[walther ppk]] to be exact, and stylish [[white gloves]]. Her arsenal also includes [[as val]] and a [[long sword|long, 1.5m to be exact, sword]].

title: emperor_hirohito
body:
[b]Hirohito[/b] (April 29, 1901 – January 7, 1989), also called by his posthumous title [b]Emperor Shōwa/Shouwa[/b], was a Japanese emperor, whose reign (1926–1989) is known as the [[shouwa|Shōwa]] period/era. He was eventually succeeded by son, [[Emperor Akihito|Akihito]], after his death.

He is known for being the Head of State of the [[Japan|Empire of Japan]] during the [[World War II]] era, his interest in marine biology and his signature phrase, "[i]Ah, so[/i]" (あっそう, "I see").

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirohito]
* [[Tag Group:People]]

title: emperor_akihito

title: emperor_antoku
body:
A 12th century emperor of [[Japan]], also known as Imperial Prince Tokihito. As a result of becoming caught up in "the Gempei War":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genpei_War], he died in his eighth year at the battle of Dan-no-ura in 1185. Together with his grandmother, Taira no Tokiko, and the [[Sword of Kusanagi]], one of the [[Japanese Regalia]], he sank to the bottom of sea at the "Kanmon Straits":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanmon_Straits].

[[Shinto]] priests claim that by performing a ritual similar to the rituals used to summon kami spirits into "shintai":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shintai], they are capable of creating sacred replicas of the Regalia, called "katashiro". If one excludes the original Sword of Kusanagi, allegedly enshrined in the "Atsuta Shrine":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atsuta_Shrine], the katashiro of the sword lost at that time is the oldest one.

His death was the source of countless tales and legends. In books such as "Heike Monogatari":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Tale_of_the_Heike and "Gukanshou":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gukansh%C5%8D], this sword was said to have been a treasure of the undersea dragon palace originally, and the [[Yamata no Orochi]] was the Dragon God or a member of its family. In order to retrieve the sword stolen by Susanoo, the Orochi reincarnated as Emperor Antoku.

In Heike Monogatari, there was an account that says when he was born, the traditional rites that are supposed to be performed when a princess is born were performed by mistake. This gave rise to many tales based on the theme that Emperor Antoku was actually female.

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Emperor Antoku":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emperor_Antoku

title: finland
body:
Finland, officially the Republic of Finland, is a sovereign state in Europe. A peninsula with the Gulf of Finland to the south and the Gulf of Bothnia to the west, the country has land borders with Sweden to the northwest, Norway to the north, and Russia to the east. Estonia is south of the country across the Gulf of Finland. Finland is situated in the geographical region of Fennoscandia, which also includes Scandinavia.

title: geow_(koseki_bijou)
body: [b]Geow[/b] is a pink-and-white rabbit-like creature introduced during [[virtual YouTuber]] [[Koseki Bijou]]'s 3D debut showcase on August 3, 2024. He has a purple gem similar to the gems prominent in Bijou's design on his forehead, and she describes him as her "buddy". Although small, cute, and evidently mute, Geow supposedly possesses terrible destructive powers. "Geow" is an acronym for what Bijou claims is his full name, [b]the Grand Executioner of Worlds[/b].

title: cactus
body: A succulent [[plant]] with a thick, fleshy stem that typically bears spines, lacks leaves, and has brilliantly colored [[flower|flowers]]. Cacti are native to arid regions of the New World and are cultivated elsewhere, especially as houseplants.

title: stethoscope
body: The stethoscope is an acoustic medical device for auscultation, or listening to the internal sounds of an animal or human body. It is often used to listen to [[lung]]s and [[heart (organ)|]] sounds. It is also used to listen to the [[stomach]] and [[intestines]] and blood flow in [[arteries]] and [[veins]]. In combination with a [[blood pressure monitor]], it is commonly used for measurements of blood pressure.

title: love_hotel
body:
A hotel intended for short stays so visitors can engage in sexual encounters. Use this tag if an image contains either an exterior view of a hotel with a suggestive name on a sign (like [i]休憩 ¥XXXX[/i]), or if characters in the image imply or mention that they're going to a love hotel with the building visible in the image. 

Combine with [[hotel room]] if the image shows a hotel room but with elements such as a suggestively-themed bed, or sex toys on the night stand, or hotel-issued condoms in a small container near the bed, etc.

title: koala
body: A herbivorous marsupial native to [[Australia]].

title: camel
body: An even-hoofed animal of the genus Camelus with distinctive fat deposits on its back called humps. The two species of camels are the [[dromedary camel]], native to the Middle East and the Horn of Africa, and the [[bactrian camel]], which inhabits Central Asia. Both camels have been domesticated and are working animals that provide milk, meat, and hair for commodities such as textiles or felted bags.

title: barber_pole
body: A sign used to indicate the location of a barber's shop. They typically consist of a helix of white, red, and blue stripes, sometimes powered by an electric motor to rotate.

title: tokyo_tower
body:
A steel lattice communications and observation tower in [[Tokyo (city)|Tokyo]]. Opened in 1958, it is painted white and international orange to comply with air safety regulations and has two circular observation decks, features which help distinguish it from its inspiration, the [[Eiffel Tower]]. It is also surrounded by high rise buildings, the presence of which hampered plans to use the Tower for digital broadcasting in the region, and resulted in the building of the taller [[Tokyo Skytree]].

It is the setting of the tokusatsu series [[Kamen Rider Kabuto (series)|Kamen Rider Kabuto]], as well as being an important location in [[Ghostwire: Tokyo]].

* !asset #22533589: "View of the tower":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Tower#/media/File:Tokyo_Tower_during_daytime.jpg

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]

h4. External links

* "Official English website":https://www.tokyotower.co.jp/en/
* "Wikipedia: Tokyo Tower":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Tower

title: statue_of_liberty
body:
The [b]Statue of Liberty[/b] ([i]Liberty Enlightening the World[/i], French: [i]La Liberté éclairant le monde[/i]) is a colossal neoclassical [[statue]] on Liberty Island in [[New York City]] Harbor.

The statue, a gift to the [[United states|United States]] from the people of [[France]], is of a robed female figure representing Libertas, the Roman goddess of freedom, who bears a torch and a tabula ansata (a tablet evoking the law) upon which is inscribed the date of the American Declaration of Independence. A broken chain lies at her feet. The statue has become an iconic symbol of freedom and of the United States.

The statue was designed by Frédéric Bartholdi and dedicated on October 28, 1886. It stands 93 meters high and weighs 204 metric tonnes. Inside the statue is a staircase that allows visitors to climb from the pedestal all the way up to the crown above her head.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Statue of Liberty":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Statue_of_Liberty

title: othinus
body:
A Magic God that was based on Norse mythology Odin. Magic God are the purest, most perfect Magician that encompasses every possibility, including positive and negative (thus all her magic always has 50/50 chance of succeeding). She wield [[Gungnir_(Toaru)|Gungnir]] to cover her 50/50 weakness, and to remake the world.

[spoiler]At the end of her arc, she uses "Turn to Fairy" spell to undo her status as a Magic God and killing her. But due to [[kamijou_touma|Kamijou Touma's]] [[imagine_breaker|Imagine Breaker]] interrupting the magic, she survived the spell and turned into [[minigirl|15cm]] [[fairy]] who lost all of her magic.[/spoiler]

title: star_trek:_strange_new_worlds
body:
A 2022-present [[Star Trek]] show, a spin-off of [[Star Trek: Discovery]] and a prequel to the [[star trek: the original series|Original Series]]. 

It focuses of the crew of the [[uss enterprise ncc-1701|USS Enterprise]] seen in the original series, but before when it was under the command of captain [b]Christopher Pike[/b]. The show features many legacy characters such as [[Spock]] and [[Nyota Uhura|Uhura]] [spoilers](and later on [[montgomery scott|Scotty]])[/spoilers], while also introducing new ones like [i]La'an Noonien Singh[/i] (a descendant of the infamous [[Khan Noonien Singh]]) and [i]Erica Ortegas[/i].

title: antoni_gaudi
body:
Antoni Gaudí (alternatively [i]Antonio Gaudí[/i]) was a renowned Spanish architect born in Catalonia. The maximum exponent in Spanish "Modernist":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Art_Nouveau] architecture, he is mostly remembered for his greatest work ― the [[Sagrada Familia]], which was designated as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO in 2005. Others of his architectural designs also received this prestigious award.

 
 
[i]Beauty is the radiance of truth, and just as art is beauty, without truth there is no art.[/i]
－Antoni Gaudí

title: sagrada_familia
body:
A Catholic [[cathedral|basilica]] in Barcelona that is, as of 2023, the largest uncompleted one in the world. Designed by the Catalan architect [[Antoni Gaudi|Antoni Gaudí]], ground was broken for it in 1882, but due to various circumstances including construction stopping and starting, it is currently scheduled to be completed after 2026. However, UNESCO has designated it as a World Heritage Site and Pope Benedict XVI both consecrated it and named it a minor basilica.

H4. External Links

"Official Site (Spanish/Catalan/English)":[https://sagradafamilia.org/en/home]

title: athletic_leotard
body:
A [[leotard]] worn for [[ballet]], [[gymnastics]], [[dancing|dance]], or other similar activities.

As these leotards are used for activities with a lot of movement the leotard either covers the shoulders or has a strap to prevent wardrobe accidents.  A strapless-like appearance may be achieved through the use of skin tone or see-through fabrics though.

For ballet and dance practices it is frequent that these leotards are worn with [[pantyhose|tights]] and typically feature flat colors.  For gymnastics it is most common that they're worn barelegged and it is not unusual for them to be made of a material featuring a sheen to them.

Official Gymnastic competitions have modesty rules for the appearance of the leotards worn by competitors.  While these do not bar someone from competing, violating it will immediately result in point deductions from their score.  The main restrictions on leotards are:

* May not be made of transparent material
* The neckline may be no lower than the sternum and the back may be no lower than the shoulder blades
* May not feature narrow straps
* The cut of the leotard at the top of the legs must not go beyond the fold of the crotch

title: tokyo_love_story
body:
[b]Tokyo Love Story[/b] is a Japanese manga written by [[Fumi Saimon]]. It was published by Shogakukan in Big Comic Spirits from 1989 to 1990 and collected into 4 tankōbon volumes.

Tokyo Love Story was adapted into a Japanese television drama in 1991 which aired on Fuji Television in 11 episodes and one special between January and March 1991. The television drama starred Yūji Oda, Honami Suzuki, and Narimi Arimori, and its theme song "ラブ・ストーリーは突然に":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love_Story_wa_Totsuzen_ni] by singer Kazumasa Oda is the 9th best-selling single in Japan. A remake premiered on FOD (Fuji TV on demand) and Amazon Prime Video in 2020. 

h4. Synopsis

Nagao Kanji who comes from Ehime Prefecture joins Heartsports company located in Tokyo, where he met lovely and sunny [[Akana Rika]]. The love story begins.

h4. External links

* "IMDb entry (1991)":[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0206518/], "IMDb entry (2020)":[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt12494314/]
* "MAL entry":[https://myanimelist.net/manga/18894/Tokyo_Love_Story]
* "Wikipedia: Tokyo Love Story":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Love_Story]

title: aac_honey_badger
body:
The [b]AAC Honey Badger[/b] is an [[AR-15]]–based compact [[assault rifle]], frequently used in a [[suppressor|suppressed]]. Chambered in proprietary .300 AAC Blackout cartridge, it was originally produced by Advanced Armament Corporation.

Both the [[gun]] and the cartridge used were developed in close co-operation with US Special Operations units to create an effective replacement for the MP5 and similar close quarters combat weapon systems.  

h4. See also

* [[Honey Badger (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: AAC Honey Badger":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AAC_Honey_Badger]

title: honey_badger
body:
The [b]honey badger[/b] (Mellivora capensis), also known as the ratel, is an omnivorous mammal widely distributed in Africa, Southwest Asia, and the Indian subcontinent.

The [[animal]] is characterized by its cylindrical body, non-prominent rounded ears, sturdy legs with five toes on each foot, and claws. Its coat color appears to be greyish beige on the upper half, and black below.

h4. See also

* [[AAC Honey Badger]]
* [[List of Animals]]

h4. External links

title: wheelie_(yume_nikki)
body:
A circular being found in the Number World.

There are four types of Wheelies, all of which share human-like legs and a wheel-shaped head:

* The first is red with facial features that most resembles a face out of the four. It starts out in the north-western corner of the map.
* The second is blue-green with some sort of design involving a [[ring]] connecting three [[diamond_(shape)|diamond shapes]] and surrounding a fourth. It spawns in the north-eastern corner of the map
* The third is dark pinkish with a [[one-eyed|single eye]]. Many instances of this type flood the Stabbing Room.
* The fourth is lime green with two [[red_pupils|red pupiled]], misshapen eyes placed diagonally from each other, and a splotch of some kind that may be a nose. It guards the door to the Stabbing Room. 

h4. External links

* "Yume Nikki Wiki: Wheelies":[https://yumenikki.fandom.com/wiki/Wheelies]

But also [[ken (barbie)|Ken]] from [[barbie (live action)|Barbie]], following the premiere of the film, Gosling was widely lauded for his performance, while Ken achieved further virality online due to his plotline involving him becoming enamored with patriarchy and bringing it to Barbieland.

title: tabuk
body:
A 7.62×39mm, gas-operated Iraqi semi-automatic [b][[sniper rifle]][/b] which its design is based from a modified version of the [[Zastava M70]] [[assault rifle]]. 

It visually resembles the Zastava M72 light machine gun which is patterned after the [[RPK]]. The Tabuk is built on a RPK-style receiver that utilizes the long-stroke piston action of the [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]] and has many parts in common with the Zastava M70 [[rifle|series]]. The Tabuk [b]differs[/b] from the M72 in some other ways. It has a provision for mounting [[scope]]s, though this is not an unusual accessory on Eastern Bloc [[weapon]]s. Second one, a skeletonized fixed wooden buttstock with a cheek piece. A third difference, is the conspicuous lack of a [[bipod]]. 

h4. See also

* [[PSL Romak]]
* [[Tabuk (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

title: joseon_dynasty
body:
[b]Joseon[/b] (조선; 朝鮮), officially [b]Great Joseon State[/b] (대조선국; 大朝鮮國), was the last dynastic kingdom of [[Korea]], lasting just over 500 years. The Joseon period has left a substantial legacy to modern Korea; much of modern Korean culture, etiquette, norms, and societal attitudes toward current issues, along with the modern [[Korean text|Korean language and its dialects]], derive from the culture and traditions of Joseon. Modern Korean bureaucracy and administrative divisions were also established during the Joseon period. 

It was founded by [[Yi Seong-gye]] in July 1392 and replaced by the [[Korean Empire]] in October 1897. The kingdom was founded following the aftermath of the overthrow of [[Goryeo]] in what is today the city of [[Kaesong]]. Early on, Korea was retitled and the capital was relocated to modern-day [[Seoul]]. The kingdom's northernmost borders were expanded to the natural boundaries at the rivers of Amrok and Tuman through the subjugation of the Jurchens. 

During its 500-year duration, Joseon encouraged the entrenchment of [[Confucianism|Confucian]] ideals and doctrines in Korean society. Neo-Confucianism was installed as the new state's ideology. [[Buddhism]] was accordingly discouraged, and occasionally Buddhists faced persecutions. Joseon consolidated its effective rule over the Korean peninsula and saw the height of classical Korean culture, trade, literature, and science and technology. In the 1590s, the kingdom was severely weakened due to the two failed Japanese invasions of 1592 and 1598. Several decades later, Joseon was invaded by the Later Jin dynasty and the [[Qing dynasty]] in 1627 and 1636–1637 respectively, leading to an increasingly harsh isolationist policy, for which the country became known as the "hermit kingdom" in Western literature. After the end of these invasions from Manchuria, Joseon experienced a nearly 200-year period of peace and prosperity, along with cultural and technological development. What power the kingdom recovered during its isolation waned as the 18th century came to a close. Faced with internal strife, power struggles, international pressure, and rebellions at home, the kingdom declined rapidly in the late 19th century.

h4. See also

* [[Korea]]
* [[Korean Empire]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Korean Empire":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseon

title: han_dynasty
body:
The [b]Han dynasty[/b] (汉朝) was an [[China|imperial dynasty of China]], established by [[Liu Bang]] and ruled by the House of Liu.

The dynasty was preceded by the short-lived [[Qin dynasty]] and a warring interregnum known as the Chu–Han contention, and it was succeeded by the [[ romance of the three kingdoms |Three Kingdoms period]]. The dynasty was briefly interrupted by the Xin dynasty established by usurping regent Wang Mang, and is thus separated into two periods—the Western Han and the Eastern Han. Spanning over four centuries, the Han dynasty is considered a golden age in [[Chinese Empire|Chinese history]], and it has influenced the identity of the Chinese civilization ever since. Modern China's majority ethnic group refer to themselves as the "Han people" or "Han Chinese". The [[Chinese text|spoken Sinitic language and written Chinese]] are referred to respectively as the "Han language" (汉语) and "Han characters" (汉字).

h4. See also

* [[China]]
* [[Chinese Empire]]
* [[Hanfu]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Han dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_dynasty

title: qin_dynasty
body:
The [b]Qin dynasty[/b] (秦朝) was the [[Chinese Empire|first dynasty]] of [[China|Imperial China]].

Named for its origin in the state of Qin, a fief of the confederal Zhou dynasty which had endured for over five centuries—until 221 BC, when it assumed an imperial prerogative following its complete conquest of its rival states, a state of affairs that lasted until its collapse in 206 BC. It was formally established after the conquests in 221 BC, when Ying Zheng, who had become king of the Qin state in 246, declared himself to be "Shi Huangdi", the first emperor.

h4. See also

* [[China]]
* [[Chinese Empire]]
* [[Qin Shi Huang]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Qin dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qin_dynasty

title: tang_dynasty
body:
The [b]Tang dynasty[/b] (唐朝), or the Tang Empire, was an [[Chinese Empire|imperial dynasty of China]] that ruled from 618 to 907, with an interregnum between 690 and 705.

It was preceded by the [[Sui dynasty]] and followed by the [[Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms]] period. Historians generally regard the Tang as a high point in [[China|Chinese civilization]], and a golden age of cosmopolitan culture. Tang territory, acquired through the military campaigns of its early rulers, rivaled that of the [[Han dynasty]].

h4. See also

* [[China]]
* [[Chinese Empire]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tang dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tang_dynasty

title: ming_dynasty
body:
The Ming dynasty, officially the Great Ming, was an imperial dynasty of China, ruling from 1368 to 1644 following the collapse of the [[mongolia|Mongol]]-led [[Yuan dynasty]]. The Ming dynasty was the last imperial dynasty of China ruled by the Han people, the majority ethnic group in [[China]]. 

Although the primary capital of [[Beijing]] fell in 1644 to a rebellion led by [[Li Zicheng]] (who established the short-lived Shun dynasty), numerous rump regimes ruled by remnants of the Ming imperial family—collectively called the Southern Ming—survived until 1662.

h4. See also

* [[China]]
* [[Chinese Empire]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ming dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ming_dynasty

title: valkyrie_(apex_legends)
body:
A playable legend from [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 9. She is the daughter of [[Viper (titanfall 2)|]],  [[Titanfall 2]]'s [[Northstar (titanfall)|]] Pilot boss. Her real name is [b]Kairi Imahara[/b] (今原カイリ).

Her launch featured several flirtatious voice lines when interacting with [[Loba (apex legends)|]], instantly making the duo a popular [[yuri]] pairing with fans.

Valkyrie has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[brown eyes]] (often changed to [[grey eyes|grey]] in anime-styled fanart). Her default outfit consists of an [[orange bodysuit]] with [[orange gloves]] worn under a metal [[breastplate]] and [[armored boots|metal]] [[thigh boots]]. In all her appearances she is equipped with a [[jetpack]] armed with [[missile pod]]s. Her heirloom weapon is the [[Suzaku (apex legends)|]].

She is one of the few legends who has an official casual outfit, which consists of a [[red jacket]] worn over a [[black sweater]] with [[black pants]] and a [[black belt]]. Often pictured wearing or holding a pair of [[aviator sunglasses]].

Valkyrie is voiced by "Erika Ishii":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erika_Ishii] in English and "Doi Mari":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%9C%9F%E4%BA%95%E7%9C%9F%E7%90%86] in Japanese.

title: menkata_(meme)
body: A meme originating from [[Yuzu-Soft]]'s game [[Sanoba Witch]]. [[Ayachi Nene]] is very excited to visit a ramen shop where she's wanted to eat for a long time. She wants to order a メンカタカラメヤサイダブルニンニクアブラマシマシ (menkatakarameyasaidaburuninnikuaburamashimashi) ramen and say it loud and clear. She's very surprised and slightly scared when she gets a large bowl of [[jirou (ramen)|jirou ramen]] she can hardly eat. The order is so strange it is thought to be a magic spell, but it comes from the actual way of ordering noodle firmness and free toppings at Ramen Jiro. The official translation of Nene's mystery ramen is "noodlesfirmspicydoubleveggyextraextragarlicoil" by NekoNyanSoft.
other_names: メンカタカラメヤサイダブルニンニクアブラマシマシ

title: full_service_(mazjojo)
body:
[[Bara]] [[visual novel]] by Herculion Games with [[Mazjojo]] as the lead illustrator. 

It follows the story of [[Tomoki Nakamoto]], a workaholic young adult who wanted a change in his life. He gets an invitation to visit the Full Service spa to take a break, after which he started visiting it more often. [[tomoki_nakamoto|Tomoki]] can choose a masseur each session, who can also evolve into his love interest.

The game was announced sometime between 2015 and 2016, and was released on February 22nd, 2020 on itch.io, followed by a [[steam_(platform) |Steam]] release on the 16th of March.

title: alpaca
body:
Alpaca (Vicugna pacos) is a domesticated species of South American camelid. It resembles a small [[llama]] in superficial appearance. The animal became popular after a Chinese meme became widespread, in which the writer claimed a photoshopped photo of an alpaca as the [b]"Grass Mud Horse"[/b] - [b]"草泥马 ([i]Cao Ni Ma[/i])"[/b].
In Japan, alpacas are popular since the mid-2000s irrespective of the Chinese movement.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article: 'Grass Mud Horse'":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grass_Mud_Horse
* "Wikipedia article: Alpaca":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alpaca

title: kami
body:
Ambiguous tag.

"Kami" is related to Japanese homonymes listed below and sometimes used as a sort of [[pun]]. Its pronunciation with "rendaku rule":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rendaku is "-gami".

* 神 - a general term for god / deity / divine spirit. When written in romanized form, it often means [[shinto]] deities.
* 紙 - [[paper]]
* 髪 - hair (on the head)
* 噛み or 咬み - [[biting]]
* 加味 - seasoning, flavoring. Use specific tags for condiments ([[salt]], [[pepper (spice)|]], [[soy sauce]], etc.) or [[cooking]]
* Another reading for 上 (Ue, "above")
* An abbreviation for 上方 (Kamigata, "Kyoto-Osaka region")
* かみさん (Kami-san) - wife
* おかみさん (O-Kami-san) - landlady

h4.General tags

* [[Special Type 2 Launch Ka-mi]] ([i]Toku Ni-shiki Uchibi-tei Kami-sha[/i]) - [[Imperial Japanese Navy]]'s amphibious [[tank]]

h4.Characters

* [[Oomiya-no-me-no-Kami]] (Miya-chan) ([[Inari Konkon Koi Iroha.]]), based on a [[shinto]] goddess with "the same name":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%85%AB%E7%A5%9E%E6%AE%BF 
* [[Uka no Mitama no Kami]] ([[Nekogami Yaoyorozu]])
* [[Yatsu-no-kami]] / Yato-no-kami - "Snake deities":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yato-no-kami appearing in "Hitachi-No-Kuni Fudoki":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fudoki#T.C5.8Dkaid.C5.8D 
* [[Kami (justdubs)|]] ([[JustDubs]])
* [[Kami-sama (dragon ball)|]] ([[Dragon Ball]])
* For other characters named kami: "kami_*":/tags?utf8=%E2%9C%93&search[name_matches]=kami_*&search[category]=4&search[hide_empty]=yes&search[sort]=date&commit=Search | "*_kami":/tags?utf8=%E2%9C%93&search[name_matches]=*_kami&search[category]=4&search[hide_empty]=yes&search[sort]=date&commit=Search

h4.Copyrights

* [[Dragon Ball Z Kami to Kami]] ([[Dragon Ball Z]]：Battle of Gods)
* [[Hin wa Bokura no Fuku no Kami]]
* [[Kami Nomi zo Shiru Sekai]]
* [[Miko Kami]] ~Docchi ni Suru no?~

h4.Artists

* For the artist formerly tagged here, see [[kami_(bright7)]].
* For some other artists named kami: "kami_* search":/artists?utf8=%E2%9C%93&search[name]=kami_*&search[sort]=Date&commit=Search | "*_kami search":/artists?utf8=%E2%9C%93&search[name]=*_kami&search[sort]=Date&commit=Search

title: kami-sama_(dragon_ball)
body:
A [[Dragon Ball]] character

An alien from planet [[Namek]], arrived on Earth as an adult. Created Earth's [[Dragon Ball (object)|Dragon Balls]]. Served as the guardian of Earth, until merging with [[Piccolo]] during the Cell saga. Needed to separate from the evil in his heart before becoming the guardian of Earth, thus creating [[Piccolo Daimaou]].

title: otoyomegatari
body:
(lit. [i]A Bride's Story[/i])

A historical romance manga by [[Mori Kaoru]]. It was published by Enterbrain in the magazine fellows! and is so far collected in 3 tankōbon volumes. The manga is licensed in English in North America by YenPress. Volume 1 was released in a hardcover format in May 2011.

Set in Central Asia in a rural town near the Caspian Sea during the early 19th century, the story revolves around a young woman, [[amir halgal|Amir]], who arrives from a distant village across the mountains to marry [[Karluk eihon]], a boy 8 years her junior. The story unfolds among details of every-day family and community life. However, the peaceful atmosphere is disturbed when Amir's family demands to take her back to their village.

h4. Characters

* [[amir halgal|Amir Halgal]]
* [[karluk eihon|Karluk Eihon]]
* [[Pariya]]
* [[mahatbek eihon|Mahatbek Eihon]]

* [[akunbek eihon|Akunbek Eihon]]

* [[Yusuf (otoyomegatari)|]]

title: arming_doublet_(southern_cross)
body:
[b][i]For arming doublet of the 15th century, use [[gambeson]]. See also "its wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gambeson].[/i][/b]

A fictional type of advanced [[military]] [[body armor]] from the [[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross]] [[mecha]] anime series from the 80s.

The [b]Arming Doublet[/b] is a type of modular, personal hard combat armor used by the different units in the army of the Southern Cross to defend the civilian population of planet Glorie.

There are several many types of customized Arming Doublets and each one is used according to the army unit that employs it. They can function as [[spacesuit]]s, [[pilot suit]]s, diving suits or even desert and cold weather operation suits. The shape of these armors also changes depending on the gender of the users and their body type.
other_names: アーミング・ダブレット

title: fn_herstal
body:
"Fabrique Nationale d'Herstal (French for: National Factory of Herstal)

[b]FN Herstal[/b] is a leading [[gun|firearms]] manufacturer located in Herstal, [[Belgium]], and is owned by the holding company Herstal Group which is owned by the regional government of Wallonia. It is currently the largest exporter of [[military]] [[weapon|small arms]] in [[Europe]]. Founded on 3 July 1889 by Henri Pieper.

title: fn_mk_46
body:
The Mk 46 (Mark 46) [b][[light machine gun]][/b] is the lighter weight variant of the [[M249 saw]] produced by [[FN Herstal]], primarily used by the [[United States]] special operations forces (SOF) since 2003. It has a four-sided rail system on the heat shield. The MOD 1 variant has a fixed polymer buttstock, while MOD 2 has adjustable telescopic one.

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Mk46 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "FN America: FN Mk 46 MOD 1":https://fnamerica.com/products/machine-guns/fn-mk-46-mod-1/
* "FN America: FN Mk 46 MOD 2":https://fnamerica.com/products/machine-guns/fn-mk-46-mod-2/

title: m60_(machine_gun)
body:
An American [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] 7.62×51mm NATO [[machine gun]], first adopted by the [[United States army]] in 1957. The M60 was widely used by the US military during the [[Vietnam War]]. Due to several design flaws, it was largely supplanted by the [[M240]] which is a derivative of the Belgian [[FN MAG]] and the light machine gun [[M249 saw]] SAW.

The M60 gained the nickname "The Pig" due to its bulky size and appetite for [[ammunition]]. The weapon is popularly depicted in many video games and war films like [[Commando (movie)|]], [[Full Metal Jacket]] and [[Rambo]]. 

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* [[M60 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: M60 machine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M60_machine_gun

title: fabarm_fp6
body:
The [b]Fabarm FP6[/B] is a 12-gauge [[pump action]] [[shotgun]] that was manufactured by the Italian firearms company Fabbrica Bresciana Armi S.p.A. and sold by [[Heckler & Koch]]. It was intended for civilian and law enforcement use. Produced since 1998. 

All FP6 shotguns are sold with a choke adjustment wrench, owners manual and a hard plastic vacu-formed impact case. Additional accessories available from H&K include an assortment of chokes, [[muzzle device|muzzle brakes]]/[[compensator]]s, [[magazine (weapon)|]] tube extensions, pistol grips and [[folding stock]]s. There is an adapter available for the receiver of the FP6 to allow use of [[Remington 870]] stocks.

A spiked black and purple FP6 is the signature [[weapon]] of [[haruka (blue archive)|Igusa Haruka]] from [[Blue Archive]].

h1. See also
* [[FP-6 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
h1. External links
* Wikipedia : "Heckler & Koch Fabarm FP6":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heckler_%26_Koch_FABARM_FP6]

title: polaroid_photo
body:
Instant on-the-spot photographs, which typically have a square photo inside a white rectangular frame. See [[polaroid camera]] for the camera itself.

Characters are often seen shaking early Polaroid instant photos to dry the ink or produce the image faster.  After the release of their sealed film packs, shaking the photos do nothing to speed the photo development and run the risk of ruining the image by creating unwanted bubbles in it if shaken too vigorously.

h4. External links

* "Official Polaroid website":http://www.polaroid.com/
* "Wikipedia: Instant camera":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instant_camera]
* "Wikipedia: Polaroid Corporation":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polaroid_Corporation]
