title: rachel_alucard
body:
A character from [[BlazBlue]]. She is a [[vampire]], and head of the Alucard clan. Bored with her mundane life, she teams up with her familiars to explore the world and fight.

She is voiced by [[Ueda Kana]] (JP) and [[Mela Lee]] (EN).

h4. Related Characters

* [[Nago]]
* [[Gii]]
other_names: レイチェル=アルカード

title: ragna_the_bloodedge
body:
The main character of [[BlazBlue]]. Also known as the "Grim Reaper," Ragna possesses a powerful form of Armagus called the Azure Grimoire, which leads others to be after not just his bounty for being a wanted criminal for destroying a branch of the NOL, but also his grimoire as well. His desire is to destroy the NOL, and nothing more.

He is voiced by [[Sugita Tomokazu]] and [[Patrick Seitz]].

h4. See also

* [[Devoured by Darkness]]
other_names: ラグナ=ザ=ブラッドエッジ

title: jin_kisaragi
body:
Jin is a Major of the NOL in [[BlazBlue]], who wields the ice-inducing sword Yukianesa. He is always cool and calm, but is also jealous, ambitious, and posessive, with little care for others, treating them as if they're just obstacles. When news arrives about Ragna, he abandons his post to go look for him.

Well known for his yandere-like obsession to Ragna The Bloodedge, his hatred for Noel Vermillion and attraction to Tsubaki Yayoi.

He has an alternate universe counterpart, [[Hakumen]].

title: shishigami_bang
body: Character from [[BlazBlue]]. Possibly the loudest ninja in existence. Has a special move which powers him up and overrides the current BGM with a JAM Project song. Is famed for being "badass normal".

title: relius_clover
body:
One of the main antagonists of [[Blazblue]]. He finally became playable in [[Blazblue: Continuum Shift]].

Father of [[Carl Clover]]. He fights with the puppet [[Ignis (blazblue)|]] created from the body of his wife.

He is voiced by [[Suwabe Jun'ichi]].

title: mario_&_sonic_at_the_olympic_winter_games
body:
Second title in the [[Mario & Sonic (series)|]] series. Released in 2009 for the [[Wii]] and [[Nintendo DS]].

This game introduces [[Donkey Kong]], [[Bowser Jr.]], [[Metal Sonic]], and [[Silver the Hedgehog]] as playable characters.

This game introduces winter sports outfits for Peach, Daisy, Amy, and Blaze. No other characters have alternate costumes.
* [[Princess Peach (Winter Sports)]]
* [[Princess Daisy (Winter Sports)]]
* [[Amy Rose (Winter Sports)]]
* [[Blaze the Cat (Winter Sports)]]

title: litchi_faye_ling
body:
A character from [[BlazBlue]].

Litchi Faye Ling is a Chinese woman who lives in Orient Town as a doctor. She is generally respected by those who know her, and is even beloved by the Kaka clan of cat-people who live beneath the city. 

She is also referred to as "The Boobie Lady" by [[Taokaka]] and most of the Kaka clan, for obvious reasons.

She is voiced by [[Takahashi Chiaki]].

title: flight_airplanes
body:
An [[airplane]] [[personification]]/[[mecha musume]] project born in the now-defunct "+NIJIURA+" imageboard forum.

The salient design feature was the depiction of the airplanes' [[wings]] as [[angel]] wings.

＋にじうら＋(+NIJIURA+) was a [[Futaba Channel]]-like imageboard that existed from 2004 through 2013. Contrary to its name, it had absolutely no connection to the original Nijigen Ura (lit. 2D Flipside) boards on [[Futaba Channel]]. It was originally a spin off from the photo image board 101 Freeway forum. A number of endemic [[os-tan|OS-tans]] were born and achieved their unique evolution there. In 2013, repeated server failures and unexpected lapses in domain names resulted in a heavy psychological burden for the +Nijiura+ administrator Boozu, who finally decided to close the board.

h4. See also

* [[Viru-tan]]
* [[Chiivistan]]
other_names: ふらいとエアプレインズ

title: magma_cube
body:
A [[monster|hostile mob]] in [[Minecraft]] that spawns in [[The Nether (minecraft)|]], commonly in nether wastes and basalt delta biomes  at almost any light level. It is dark red, cubic [[slime (creature)|]] with glowing [[yellow eyes]]. Moves by bouncing and can repeatedly attack the player through collision. When a big or medium magma cube is killed, it splits into 2-4 smaller magma cubes. 

Magma Cubes have higher health points compared to its [[slime (Minecraft)|Overworld counterpart]]. They drop [[magma cream]] upon death, essential ingredient of magma blocks and fire resistance potion. When a [[frog (Minecraft)|]] eats a small magma cube, it drops a froglight.

h4. See also
* [[Slime (minecraft)|]]
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Magma Cube":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Magma_Cube

title: wither_(minecraft)
body:
An extremely destructive, optional boss in [[Minecraft]], encountered only if the player deliberately summons it by putting four [[soul sand]] blocks in T-shaped formation and three [[wither skull]]s on top. It resembles a giant, levitating dark grey skeleton with three heads and no limbs.

The Wither drops only a [[nether star]] upon death, for crafting a [[beacon (minecraft)|]].

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Wither":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Wither

body:
[[Minecraft]] item crafted using glass and a [[Nether star]]. Placing it on top of an array of mineral blocks will cast a beam of light into the sky. It also will give potion effects of the player's choice to any nearby players.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Beacon":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Beacon

body:
Item from [[Minecraft]]. Dropped when the [[Wither (minecraft)|]] is defeated, used solely to craft [[beacon (minecraft)|]]s.

h4. External links

title: end_crystal
body:
Item in [[Minecraft]] that spawns in [[the End (minecraft)|]] and must be destroyed in order to kill the [[Ender Dragon]], as she can heal using them. They explode on contact. Crafted using [[ghast tear]]s.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: End Crystal":https://minecraft.wiki/w/End_Crystal

title: ender_dragon
body:
The ostensible "final boss" of [[Minecraft]] and the largest single mob in the game. The Ender Dragon is a giant black [[dragon]] that appears solely in [[the end (minecraft)|The End]], where it flies through the sky and swoops down to attack the player. To kill it, the player must first destroy a series of [[end crystal]]s atop obsidian spires, which the Ender Dragon will use to heal any damage it sustains.

On her first death, she will drop a [[dragon egg (minecraft)|]].

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Ender Dragon":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ender_Dragon

title: zombie_villager_(minecraft)
body:
[[Zombie|Zombified]] variant of the [[villager (minecraft)|villagers]] in [[Minecraft]]. They are curable by applying weakness potion or tipped arrow and feeding it a golden apple. After reverting into human form, they will offer significant trade discount after acquiring a job.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]
* [[Zombie (minecraft)|]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Zombie Villager":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Zombie_Villager

title: nether_fortress
body:
Structure that spawns in [[the Nether (minecraft)|]] in [[Minecraft]]. Made of Nether brick, houses [[wither skeleton (minecraft)|]]s and a [[blaze (minecraft)|]] spawner. Also one of the only initial sources of nether wart, an essential ingredient in potion brewing.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Nether Fortress":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Nether_Fortress

title: wither_skeleton_(minecraft)
body:
A tall, black, [[undead]] [[skeleton|hostile mob]] in [[Minecraft]]. They are armed with stone [[sword]]s and only spawn in the [[Nether Fortress]]. Unlike their [[skeleton (Minecraft)|Overworld counterpart]] with bows. They deal deadly wither effect that turns [[health bar|player's hearts]] black and depletes health. 

Upon death it can either drop [[bone]], [[coal]], or stone swords with random durability points. This includes small chance (2.5%) of dropping its own [[wither skull|skull]]. The [[Wither (Minecraft)|]] boss has chance to summon 3-4 wither skeletons on ground.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Wither Skeleton":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Wither_Skeleton

title: witch_(minecraft)
body:
Hostile mob from [[Minecraft]] that attacks the player by throwing potions of harming, slowness or poison. Occasionally spawns in light level of zero, during raids or at swamp huts. They are capable of regenerating health.

[[Witch]]es have the most varied drops, ranging from gunpowder, [[glowstone]] dust, [[redstone dust]], sticks, sugar, spider eyes, and glass bottles.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Witch":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Witch

title: vindicator_(minecraft)
body:
An hostile mob in [[Minecraft]] armed with an iron [[axe]]. Vindicators attack the player, [[villager (Minecraft)|villagers]], [[iron golem (Minecraft)|Iron Golems]] or [[wandering trader (Minecraft)|Wandering Traders]]—dealing high amount of melee damage. It is recommended for player to wear a full set of armor (better than iron) while fighting them. Drops [[green gemstone|emeralds]] and sometimes an iron axe with random durability, also an ominous [[banner]] if it was worn on head. 

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]
* [[Pillager (minecraft)|]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Vindicator":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Vindicator

title: stray_(minecraft)
body:
Undead hostile mob in [[Minecraft]] that naturally spawns on cold, snowy biomes. Shoots tipped arrows that inflict slowing effect.

When a [[Skeleton (minecraft)|]] is submerged in powdered snow for around 30 seconds, it will turn into Stray.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Stray":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Stray

title: cliffheart_(highlands_visitor)_(arknights)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Cliffheart_(Arknights)|Cliffheart]] from [[Arknights]] made in collaboration with World Wildlife Fund.

title: spider_jockey_(minecraft)
body:
Hostile mob in [[Minecraft]], a [[skeleton (minecraft)|]] that spawns riding a [[spider (minecraft)|]].

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Spider Jockey":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Spider_Jockey
other_names: スパイダージョッキー

title: slime_(minecraft)
body:
A mob in [[Minecraft]]. Slimes spawn rarely, and usually only on the deepest levels of a map or at night in swamp biomes (depending on the phase of the moon).

Slimes can spawn in any of three sizes (Big, Small, and Tiny), depending on how much room there is in an area prone to spawning slimes. When big and small slimes are killed, they spawn multiple slimes of the next size down. Tiny slimes, although they will attack the player, do no damage and are the only hostile mob that can spawn naturally on the Peaceful difficulty setting.

h4. See also
* [[Magma Cube]]
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Slime":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Slime

title: skeleton_(minecraft)
body:
A common [[undead]] hostile mob in [[Minecraft]]. [[Skeleton]]s spawn in the Overworld when the light level is zero (since 1.18 update), or in [[the Nether (minecraft)|]]'s soul sand valley biome. They shoot the player with good accuracy. They drop [[arrow (projectile)|arrows]] and [[bone]]s upon death, sometimes [[bow (weapon)|bows]] with random durability.

Like [[zombie]]s and [[phantom (minecraft)|]]s, skeletons also burn under the [[sunlight]]. But they will seek for nearby water source or any shaded places.

h4. See also
* [[Stray (minecraft)|]]
* [[Wither Skeleton (minecraft)|]]
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Skeleton":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Skeleton

title: experience_orb
body:
Small green and yellow [[orb]]s that drop when a player or mob is killed or some other task is completed in [[Minecraft]], that the player can pick up for experience levels they can use for [[enchantment (minecraft)|]].

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Experience":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Experience

title: silverfish_(minecraft)
body:
Small, grey hostile mob found hiding in infested stone-like blocks in [[mountain]]s, strongholds, [[igloo]] [[basement]]s and woodland [[mansion]]s. 

Despite dealing low damage, those [[bug]]s can be really annoying to encounter because of their small hitbox and they seem to come out of nowhere due to lack of visually-distinguishable way to tell infested stone blocks apart from normal ones. There is also a chance to find a silverifsh spawner inside a stronghold. Has 8 health points (4 hearts). 

Breaking stone blocks with Silk Touch pickaxe will prevent silverfish from coming out. Bane of Anthropods [[enchantment (minecraft)|]] deals more damage against them. Silverfish drop nothing upon death but a few [[experience orb]]s.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Silverfish":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Silverfish

[[Indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber]].

title: shulker_box
body:
A block in [[Minecraft]] that stores items, also serves as additional portable inventory storage. Unlike chests and [[barrel]]s, its items will stay inside while broken, even without a Silk Touch-enchanted tool. Crafted from two [[shulker shell]]s and a chest. It originally has the same colour as the [[shulker]], but can be dyed into various hues.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Shulker Box":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Shulker_Box

title: shulker_shell
body:
Item in [[Minecraft]], dropped by [[Shulker]]s when killed. Used to craft [[Shulker Box]]es.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Shulker Shell":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Shulker_Shell

title: pillager_(minecraft)
body:
A hostile mob in [[Minecraft]] that belongs to Illager clan. Armed with a [[crossbow]] to shoot the player, [[Villager (minecraft)|Villagers]], or [[iron golem (minecraft)|Iron Golems]]. Pillagers spawn during raids, in outposts, or occasionally patrols.

Killing a Pillager captain (with banner on head) will give the player an ominous bottle that grants Bad Omen effect if drank, thus triggering a raid when they enter a village.

h4. See also
* [[Vindicator (minecraft)|]]
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Pillager":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Pillager

title: piglin_brute
body:
The stronger, hostile variant of [[piglin]] that sports black clothing, golden armguard, and wields a golden [[axe]]. Only found at Bastion Remnant structure in the Nether dimension. They will not respawn after death. Has 50 health points (25 hearts) and deals more melee damage compared to regular piglins. Cannot barter and will not be distracted with gold items. Piglin brutes will also attack [[wither skeleton (minecraft)|]]s on sight.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Piglin Brute":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Piglin_Brute

title: phantom_membrane
body:
Item from [[Minecraft]], dropped by [[Phantom (minecraft)|]]s when killed. Used for repairing [[elytra (minecraft)|]] and brewing Slow Falling potions.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Phantom Membrane":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Phantom_Membrane

title: phantom_(minecraft)
body:
Hostile mobs in [[Minecraft]] that harass and attack the player if they do not sleep for multiple days in a row. They are winged creatures with dark blue skin and green eyes. They are warded off by [[Cat (minecraft)|]]s. When killed, they drop [[phantom membrane]]s.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Phantom":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Phantom

title: husk_(minecraft)
body:
A variant of [[Minecraft]] [[zombie (minecraft)|]] that exclusively spawns in [[desert]]s, identifiable by its khaki-colored clothing. Husks do not burn under the sun and they can inflict hunger effect.

A husk will turn into regular zombie after being submerged in water for about 30 seconds.

h4. See also
* [[Drowned (minecraft)|]]
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Husk":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Husk

title: hoglin
body:
[[Boar]]-like [[monster|hostile mob]] in [[Minecraft]]. Hoglins spawn in crimson forest biome or certain parts of bastion remnants in [[The Nether (minecraft)|]]. They are great source of [[pork]] and [[leather]]. Baby hoglins attacks and run faster than the adult counterparts, while dealing far less damage. So it is advised to bring shield while confronting them.

Hoglins are breedable by feeding [[mushroom|crimson fungus]]. A group of [[Piglin]]s sometimes hunt them. While being in the Overworld or [[the end (minecraft)|The End]] after approximately 30 seconds, a hoglin will [[zombification|zombify]] into Zoglin.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Hoglin":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Hoglin

title: guardian_(minecraft)
body:
Hostile [[Minecraft]] mob that spawns in ocean monuments.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Guardian":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Guardian

title: ghast_tear
body:
Item in [[Minecraft]] dropped when a [[ghast]] is killed. Mostly used for potion brewing, but can also be used to craft [[End Crystal]]s.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Ghast Tear":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ghast_Tear

title: endermite
body:
Small, purple, [[bug]]-like hostile mob in [[Minecraft]]. There is a small chance of an endermite to spawn as the result of throwing an ender pearl. 

Similar to the [[silverfish (Minecraft)]], it has 8 health points (4 hearts) but deals slightly higher attack damage and looks shorter compared to its grey counterpart. An endermite can upset any [[enderman]] on sight within range of 64 blocks, causing them to chase and attack it. 

Affected by the Bane of Anthropods [[enchantment (minecraft)|]]. Drops nothing but few [[experience orb]]s.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Endermite":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Endermite

title: elder_guardian_(minecraft)
body:
Stronger, larger counterpart of the [[Guardian (minecraft)|Guardians]] in [[Minecraft]]. Grey in color, they are seen protecting ocean monuments. Their special ability is causing mining fatigue effect that significantly slows down the player's speed of breaking blocks and attack speed.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Elder Guardian":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Elder_Guardian
other_names: エルダーガーディアン

title: drowned_(minecraft)
body:
[[Undead]] [[zombie|hostile mob]] in [[Minecraft]] that spawns [[underwater]], identifiable by the blue-colored skin. Very few of them are armed with a [[trident]]. They are also decent source of copper [[steel ingot|ingots]].

Regular [[zombie (minecraft)|zombies]] will turn into Drowned after being submerged for about 30 seconds.

h4. See also
* [[Husk (minecraft)|]]
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Drowned":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Drowned

title: charged_creeper
body:
When a [[creeper]] roams the [[Minecraft]] world and gets struck by [[lightning]], it becomes a charged creeper, which has electric blue aura surrounding it. Its [[explosion|explosive]] damage and radius will be much greater.

If certain mobs like a [[zombie (minecraft)|]] or [[piglin]] were killed by its explosion, their heads will drop as collectible items.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Charged Creeper":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Charged_Creeper
other_names: 擬人化帯電クリーパー

title: blaze_(minecraft)
body:
A hostile flying fire creature from [[Minecraft]], found in [[the Nether (minecraft)|]]. Drops [[blaze rod]]s when killed.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Blaze":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Blaze

title: wolf_(minecraft)
body:
Neutral [[Minecraft]] mob, comes in numerous variations. Can be tamed using [[bone]]s, after which they will gain a [[collar]] and will follow the player.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links

title: spider_(minecraft)
body:
Common mob in [[Minecraft]]. It has dark grey body and multiple [[red eyes]]. Capable of climbing up blocks. Has 16 health points (8 hearts). Drops [[string]] and spider eye upon death. It will become neutral under [[sunlight]]. 

h4. See also
* [[Cave Spider]]
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]
